The power of the diversity in our international sides is incredible.  There is more buzz around domestic game than there has been since I began following it 30 years ago.  However Euro 2028 feels like a distraction from hard work that needs to be done.  Happy to be proved wrong.

Lack of a pyramid system means grassroots football is at best untidy & is crying out for reform.  Culturally the Irish obsession with English football continues.  But there are positives:  This game changes more lives & lifts more people on the margins than any other.

The infrastructure deficit in the game is still profound.  30% of LOI players only have Junior Cert as qualification.  Game not knitted into our school structure as other codes are.  LOI teams have huge turnover in playing staff every year with contracts being very insecure.

Really can‚Äôt get excited by our involvement in Euro 2028.  Feels like huge distraction from fundamental fault lines in the game here.  It‚Äôs not even 5 years since the Women‚Äôs team had to threaten strike action.  It‚Äôs not even 3 years since the former CEO resigned in disgrace.  üßµ https://t.co/ekdd3k0uLM
